Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands are catching up after their win against South Africa, while Sri Lanka have struggled in the World Cup so far.
Scott Edwards and Dilshan Madushanka are expected to be key players in the match.
Team news: Netherlands could name an unchanged XI, while Sri Lanka might have Kusal Perera to undergo a late check-up.
Pitch and conditions: The pitch in Lucknow is expected to have a touch more grass and offer more to the seamers.
Stats and trivia: Sri Lanka haven't lost the opening three games of a World Cup since 1987, when they lost all six of their matches.
Bas de Leede has seven wickets in the competition so far. Four more will see him equal the most for Netherlands in a World Cup, a record currently held by his father, Tim de Leede.
